About

I’m a husband to a loving wife and a proud father to a beautiful daughter. With a deep love for technology, I’m always eager to explore new gadgets and experiment with my smart home and home lab setups.

Professionally, I’m a penetration tester working towards my OSCP certification, constantly challenging myself to grow and refine my skills. I enjoy sharing my journey on my website through detailed write-ups of challenges I’ve completed on platforms like Hack The Box, Proving Grounds, and other virtual labs, contributing to the infosec community.

Outside of work, my passions include sports climbing, particularly bouldering, and freeskating—activities that keep me energised and focused. My curiosity for technology and innovation ensures I’m always learning and adapting to the ever-changing tech landscape.

Work [ + ]

Deloitte Singapore

[+] Consultant (Cyber Risk)
  • Conducted Network and Web Application Penetration Testing, identifying vulnerabilities that enhanced overall security posture.
  • Conducted source code reviews, enhancing code quality and identifying potential vulnerabilities.
  • Conducted engagements in public sectors including NEA, MOH, and public hospitals, enhancing collaboration and improving service delivery.
  • Facilitated kick-off meetings to define the scope of engagements, ensuring all stakeholders had a clear understanding of project objectives.
  • Utilized tools including Kali Linux, Burp Suite, ZAP, Nessus Vulnerability Scanner, PentestBox, Metasploit, and Fortify Static Code Analyzer.
  • Compiled comprehensive reports for clients, featuring an executive summary and a technical analysis, enhancing client understanding and decision-making.
  • Collaborated with stakeholders to address findings based on provided recommendations, ensuring additional support was available when further assistance was necessary.

    Recent Projects

    Home Lab

    A home lab to host various services and applications to improve quality of life. Also contains virtual labs meant for testing and ethical hacking.

    Description:
    • Deployed Promox VE on a Mini PC to spin up VMs and LXCs for hosting of servers and applications.
    • Made use of Docker to easily spin up lightweight containers of applications to improve quality of life.
    • Self-hosted applications provide a sense of control and security over personal data as compared to those hosted and controlled by third-parties.
    • Currently in the process of upgrading the home lab hardware to increase memory and storage.
    • Have plans to self-host open-source LLMs in the future as most Generative AI services online have limited free use.
    • Proxmox
    • Virtual Machines
    • LXC (Linux Container)
    • Docker
    • Docker-compose
    • Portainer
    • Linux distributions

    Smart Home

    Personal project to automate my home.

    Description:
    • Deployed an open-source smart home automation software, Home Assistant, in my Home Lab to control and interface smart devices in the house.
    • Installed smart devices such as smart switches, smart plugs, smart lights, smart speakers, smart doorbell, motion sensors, presence sensors, light sensors and door sensors.
    • Configured and deployed the smart devices using wireless protocols such as Zigbee, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.
    • Created several automations for a smart home experience.
    • Currently experimenting with a local voice assistant to replace Google Assistant / Amazon Alexa.
    • Constantly adding more devices and updating existing ones.
    • Home Assistant
    • Zigbee2MQTT
    • MQTT
    • Zigbee
    • Wi-Fi
    • Bluetooth
